title: 112_hr6420
content:
The Act is titled the "Federal Financial Assistance Management Improvement Act of 2012". It includes findings related to financial assistance management. The Act titled the "Federal Financial Assistance Management Improvement Act of 2012" includes findings that there are over 600 Federal financial assistance programs, some of which have duplicative and burdensome administrative requirements, hindering cost-effective service delivery. Streamlining these procedures will improve services to the public. The Act aims to enhance Federal financial assistance programs by improving effectiveness, simplifying application processes, enhancing service delivery, and promoting coordination among service providers. It also includes definitions for clarity. The Act defines key terms such as Director, Federal agency, Federal financial assistance, local government, non-federal entity, and nonprofit organization. The term "nonprofit organization" refers to entities operated for public interest, not for profit, and use proceeds for organization operations. The term "State" includes all states, territories, and possessions of the United States. The curr_chunk defines "tribal government" as an Indian tribe and "uniform administrative rule" as a Governmentwide rule for national policy objectives across Federal agencies. The duties of the director are outlined in Section 5. The Director, in consultation with agency heads and representatives of non-Federal entities, shall direct, coordinate, and assist Federal agencies in implementing a common application and reporting system for Federal financial assistance programs. This system includes a common application for multiple programs and a common electronic system for managing and reporting funding. The Director, in consultation with agency heads and representatives of non-Federal entities, shall establish uniform administrative rules and an interagency process for streamlining Federal financial assistance programs. This includes simplifying administrative procedures, improving coordination, and sharing data efficiently. The Director may designate a lead agency and use interagency working groups to improve the timeliness, completeness, and quality of information received by Federal agencies from recipients of Federal financial assistance. Agencies must submit information for review regarding their implementation of this Act, and exemptions may be granted if a Federal agency has few financial assistance programs. The Director will maintain a list of exempted agencies for Federal financial assistance programs, available on the Office of Management and Budget website. A report with recommendations for improving these programs must be submitted to Congress within 18 months of the Act's enactment, and all required actions must be completed within the same timeframe. SEC. 6. COLLECTION OF INFORMATION: The Act allows Federal agencies to gather necessary information for reviewing financial integrity of activities receiving Federal financial assistance. 

SEC. 7. JUDICIAL REVIEW: Judicial review of compliance with the Act is not permitted, and no rights or benefits can be enforced through administrative or judicial actions.

SEC. 8. STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS: The Act does not override statutory requirements for Federal financial assistance programs.

SEC. 9. EFFECTIVE DATE AND SUNSET: Specifies the effective date and sunset provisions of the Act. The Act will be effective upon enactment and will expire 8 years later.
